summary: SaaS web application for cricket tournaments/leagues with real-time ball-by-ball scoring, automatic stats calculations, team/player management, live scoreboard display, and modern sports dashboard UI.
architectural_notes: SaaS / multi-tenant data model to support multiple tournaments/leagues with reusable structure.
Real-time scoring and scoreboard updates require a live update mechanism (e.g., WebSockets/SSE) and consistent event-driven stats recalculation.
Core persistence entities: Users, Tournaments, Matches, Teams, Players, BallByBallEvents, DerivedStatistics.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Cricket-themed app logo, clean modern mark, flat vector style (cric-logo.dim_512x512.png)
- Subtle sports dashboard background illustration featuring cricket pitch elements, low-contrast, minimal detail (dashboard-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)

existing_features.title: Add authentication and authorization using Internet Identity, and enforce role-based access control across backend methods and frontend routes: Admin (full access), Scorer (can create/update matches and submit ball-by-ball scoring), Viewer (read-only).

Create a modern sports dashboard UI shell with responsive sidebar navigation and pages: Dashboard, Matches, Live Scoring, Scoreboard, Teams, Players, Reports; ensure consistent layout and mobile responsiveness.

Establish a coherent, distinct visual theme for the app (colors, typography, spacing, components) suitable for a professional sports dashboard, and apply it consistently across all pages (avoid blue/purple as the primary palette).
Implement Tournament management UX and API integration: create/list/select tournament context and scope all matches/teams/players views and creation flows to the selected tournament.
Build Team Management: create teams, view team list/details, add/remove players to/from teams, and assign a captain per team.
Build Player Management: create players, assign a default team (optional), and display player statistics (aggregated from ball-by-ball events) including batting and bowling summaries.
Implement Match Management: create a match (select Team A/Team B, overs limit), track match status (Upcoming/Live/Completed), and support start/end match actions.
Implement Live Scoring Panel for ball-by-ball input for a Live match, including fast buttons for runs (0,1,2,3,4,6), Wicket, Wide, and No Ball, and persist each delivery/event to the backend.

Implement Live Scoreboard Display page for a selected match showing: team score (Runs/Wickets), overs, run rate, current batsman, current bowler, and match status, and ensure it auto-refreshes while the match is Live.
Build Dashboard page showing KPIs and recent activity: total matches, live matches, teams count, players count, and a recent matches list (scoped to the active tournament).

Implement Reports page that can generate and display match summaries for completed matches, including innings totals, fall of wickets (if available from events), and top batting/bowling performers computed from recorded events.
Add static generated brand assets and integrate them into the UI (app logo + subtle dashboard background/hero) by serving them from frontend static assets (not via backend).

new_feature_requests.summary: Modern dashboard with KPIs (total/live matches, teams, players) and recent matches list
Match management: create matches, select teams, set overs limit, start/end match, status tracking (Upcoming/Live/Completed)
Team management: create teams, add players, assign captain, store team data
Player management: create players, assign to teams, track player statistics
Live scoring panel for ball-by-ball events (runs buttons, wicket, wide, no-ball) with automatic score/overs/wickets calculations
Live scoreboard display page (runs/wickets, overs, run rate, current batsman/bowler, match status) with auto-refresh/real-time updates
Statistics engine to compute batsman (runs, balls, strike rate), bowler (wickets, economy), and match stats from ball-by-ball events
Tournament support: multi-tournament structure, multiple matches, match history and results storage
User roles & access control: Admin (full), Scorer (score matches), Viewer (read-only)
Reports page and match summary generation

Implement backend data model and persistence for a multi-tournament cricket scoring SaaS, storing: Users (with roles), Tournaments, Teams, Players, Matches, Innings, and BallByBall events, plus derived per-innings and per-player statistics that can be queried efficiently.

Create the scoring and statistics engine that derives match state from ball-by-ball events: total runs, wickets, overs/balls, run rate, current batsman/bowler, batsman runs/balls/strike rate, bowler wickets/economy, and match summary statistics.
